text: Nanchenjiazhuang () is a small village in Sishui County, in the Chinese province of Shandong. It has a population of about 2,000. Nanchenjiazhuang is an important production base of pesticide- and fertilizer-free cereals and vegetables. This village, though small, has a cultural history dating back more than 3000 years. A Han dynasty tomb, roughly two millennia old, was excavated in 1984, at the foot of the sacred Zhaoyang Hill. To the west of the village is the mausoleum of a Song dynasty princess. Category:Geography of Shandong
title: Nanchenjiazhuang
